content:
Contract terms and pricing are crucial aspects to consider when choosing an electricity provider. Here's a breakdown of the contract terms and pricing for each of the providers I mentioned earlier:

**Puget Sound Energy (PSE)**

* Contract terms:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: 12-month contract term, with a $50 early termination fee (ETF) if you cancel before the end of the term.
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: 24-month contract term, with a $100 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
* Pricing:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: around 9.5 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: around 9.2 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ Tiered pricing: PSE has a tiered pricing structure, which means your rate will increase as your usage increases.
* Other fees:
	+ Late payment fee: $10
	+ Returned payment fee: $20
	+ Meter reading fee (if you request a manual read): $20

**Constellation Energy**

* Contract terms:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: 12-month contract term, with a $50 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: 24-month contract term, with a $100 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
* Pricing:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: around 9.2 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: around 9.0 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ Flat rate pricing: Constellation offers a flat rate pricing structure, which means your rate will remain the same regardless of your usage.
* Other fees:
	+ Late payment fee: $10
	+ Returned payment fee: $20

**Xfinity Energy**

* Contract terms:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: 12-month contract term, with a $50 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: 24-month contract term, with a $100 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
* Pricing:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: around 9.5 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: around 9.3 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ Tiered pricing: Xfinity Energy has a tiered pricing structure, which means your rate will increase as your usage increases.
* Other fees:
	+ Late payment fee: $10
	+ Returned payment fee: $20
	+ Meter reading fee (if you request a manual read): $20

**Direct Energy**

* Contract terms:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: 12-month contract term, with a $50 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: 24-month contract term, with a $100 ETF if you cancel before the end of the term.
* Pricing:
	+ 12-month fixed rate plan: around 9.3 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ 24-month fixed rate plan: around 9.1 cents/kWh (varies depending on usage)
	+ Flat rate pricing: Direct Energy offers a flat rate pricing structure, which means your rate will remain the same regardless of your usage.
* Other fees:
	+ Late payment fee: $10
	+ Returned payment fee: $20

Please note that prices and contract terms are subject to change, and some providers may have additional fees or requirements. It's essential to review the fine print and ask questions before signing up with a provider.
